stanza.l: Love bade me welcome, yet my soul drew back,
But quick-eyed Love, observing me grow slack
Drew nearer to me, sweetly questioning
A guest, I answered, worthy to be here;
Love said, You shall be he.

l.i: I, the unkind, the ungrateful? ah my dear,

stanza.l: Love took my hand and smiling did reply,

l.love: Who made the eyes but I?

l.i: Truth, Lord, but I have marred them; let my shame

stanza.l: And know you not, says Love, who bore the blame?

l.i: My dear, then I will serve.

stanza.l: You must sit down, says Love, and taste my meat.
So I did sit and eat.
